item.title: Congressman's constituency
item.description: House Speaker Sam Rayburn and Sen. Everett Dirksen discuss opinion polls and the wisdom of following the wishes of the majority.
item.dc:creator: O'Connor, Daniel
item.dc:subject: United States. Congress.

item.title: Congressmen & administrative agencies
item.description: Rep. John McCormack ("There's a greater law than manmade law; there's the law of God") and Rep. William Bray ("We have found some agencies that certainly far outlived their usefulness for many years.")
item.dc:creator: O'Connor, Daniel
item.dc:subject: United States. Congress.

item.title: Congressman & Supreme Court
item.description: Sen. James O. Eastland ("The court has wrapped a blanket of immunity around the Communist conspiracy in this country") and Sen. Wayne Morse
item.dc:creator: O'Connor, Daniel
item.dc:subject: United States. Congress.

item.title: Congressman's constituency
item.description: House Speaker Sam Rayburn and Sen. Everett Dirksen discuss opinion polls and the wisdom of following the wishes of the majority.
item.dc:creator: O'Connor, Daniel
item.dc:subject: United States. Congress.

item.title: Congressman's lobbies
item.description: Sen. Hubert Humphrey ("Any contribution to any lobby of $50 or more ought to be registered") and Sen. Homer E. Capehart
item.dc:creator: O'Connor, Daniel
item.dc:subject: United States. Congress.

item.title: Congressman's party
item.description: Sen. Frank Lausche ("Never oppose a cause that is good even though it is sponsored by the opposing political party...) and Rep. Charles Halleck
item.dc:creator: O'Connor, Daniel
item.dc:subject: United States. Congress.

item.title: Congressman & President
item.description: This program presents interviews with Senator Richard Russell ("Congress has lost a great deal of prestige over the past 25 years") and Representative Joseph W. Martin ("Pres. Eisenhower is not the forceful, fighting type of either of the Roosevelts").
item.dc:creator: O'Connor, Daniel
item.dc:subject: United States. President
